This app makes Homey support Tuya Zigbee devices!  
 Tuya Zigbee devices are white label products and found with many brands, each brand will have a unique manufacturerName ID and this will have to be added to the app. 
 Live version:  Tuya Zigbee App for Homey | Homey  
Test version:  Tuya Zigbee | Homey  
 
 Thanks for all the interest in the app, I‚Äôm very thankfull for all the help and support! 
 If you are unable to help maintain and develop the app and want to support me in any other way I‚Äôm happy for any and all  donations via Paypal  !   
 
   PROCESS FOR REPORTING AN ISSUE WITH THE APP   
If/When you find issues please create a crash report from the app and add your name to it and give me a notice on Github, here or in PM. 
 
   PROCESS FOR REQUESTING DEVICES TO BE ADDED   
If your device is not supported by the app it will have to be added by adding code to the app, this is done by me or by someone helping me out (anyone can - it‚Äôs open source   ). 
  To be able to add more devices I will need help with interviews of the devices you want added. Anyone asking for a device to be added will have to have:  
 
 upgraded to firmware v5 
 have a physical example of the device 
 add it as a generic Zigbee device 
 go to  https://developer.athom.com/tools/zigbee   and interview the device 
 copy the info (by clicking the copy button/icon!) and post it as a  new issue  at the apps Github repository(</>). 
 
 Github:  GitHub - JohanBendz/com.tuya.zigbee  
 
 I request that all device requests be directed to Github. The reason is straightforward: previously, when requests were made in this thread, I had to manually create an issue on Github, transfer the information, fill in any missing details, and then schedule the device to be added. Additionally, many requests were either duplicates or inquiries about the status of an existing request. 
 I hope that creating a Github account (which is free and straightforward) isn‚Äôt too much to ask. Doing so will significantly streamline my process for handling requests and follow-ups. I believe this approach will also encourage more individuals to contribute code. 
 Old requests made in this thread can be found here: 
 https://community.homey.app/t/app-pro-tuya-zigbee-app-device-request-archive/  
 You are, and will always be, more than welcome to discuss the app, report problems, seek support, share ideas, and more in this thread. All I ask is that device requests be made on  Github .

Hi all. 
I‚Äôll try to answer a bunch of questions here‚Ä¶ 
 No, the app for firmware 4.2 will NOT be updated with all the nice devices I am now updating the firmware 5 version with, mainly because the Zigbee updated stack in Firmware 5 is needed to support a majority of the devices. 
 Yes, I aim to support Christmas lights before Christmas   Edit: WOW‚Ä¶ I had a closer look at this one and this can turn out to be a challenge. Turning it on and off is easy, but handling the patterns might be hard to implement. It looks like the devices from  Twinkly App for Homey | Homey  but I guess the Lidl app does not let you scan the Christmas tree like Twinkly does. Is there like 12 patterns or what does it look like? What would be a good start? 
 No, if you are unable to add a device to Homey it‚Äôs not the app that is the problem. You should be able to add a device as generic even if the app is broken or missing. So‚Ä¶ pairing issues is always a Homey issue and I urge anyone with this problem to call/mail Athom Support or turn to threads about connection issues. 
 Yes, I aim to release the app as open source. There are however a few things I want to be done with first so the app is not spinning in all directions. (adding Tuya Specific Cluster Support and make app structure clean and nice to work with etc). 
 There is now a (short) list of known issues that I am working on and I am super happy for the feedback, help and support I get from you all. Keep up the great work!

Hi all. 
To be honnest I was expecting quite some interest in the Github repository for this app with issues/requests for devices and ppl interested in testing early versions of the app, and perhaps also some pull requests‚Ä¶   
 Well, none have so far‚Ä¶ so I will start adding early test code for some devices in the test app and hope to get help testing them this way. 
 Such devices will be named ‚ÄúTest Device - And the name of the device‚Äù and will be removed once testing is done and then replaced by a working driver/device. 
 First versions of a test device will likely not work at all, it will contain a code that catches what the device does and then any testers are expected to send me crash logs that will contain the information I need to complete the drivers. 
 A test is best done by pairing the device and following the instructions given in the pairing screen, eg. test XYZ and send a crash report, then remove the device again. 
 So, again‚Ä¶ a heads up‚Ä¶ if you see ‚ÄúTest Device - XYZ‚Äù in upcoming versions of the test app, remember they are just that‚Ä¶

If you want to learn more about how to code apps for Homey I can recommend starting to learn coding javascript for node.js:  NodeSchool . It‚Äôs quite fun when you get the hang of it   and will help alot to understand what happens in the code you see in the apps. 
 Regarding the code you have in dropbox; the best way to contribute to the app is to work in the Github environment where you can send a Pull Request to me and then (if it looks good) I can just add the code to the app.:  JohanBendz/com.tuya.zigbee (github.com)

I‚Äôm not back‚Ä¶ I never left   
 I‚Äôv been busy fixing up the apps to work with the new bridge and for this app especially I have a few major issues I need to work out before I can add the more complex devices. This is why thermostates and likes are still under development. 
 I have no issues with ppl flooding the thread with requests for new units, but please do read the top post first‚Ä¶ and add an url to where I can see the device‚Ä¶ Tuya is not very good on standards and mix device Id‚Äôs between units so I have a hard time to tell if something is an X or Y without some additional info. 
 As always I try to prioritize adding new codes to already added units, so if your unit is published on the app page but it does not pair with the app please pair it as a generic unit and send me the modelId and manufacturerName together with what unit it is. 
 Regarding the long list of devices I am always happy for any help, be it a PR or help fixing issues or parts of the code needed for adding new devices or features.

Hi all. 
I understand that many wait for their devices to be added and are (im)patiently waiting for the next release and the next one after that and so forth‚Ä¶ And an update will come‚Ä¶ when I have an update ready and the time to release and support it.  That said I will not do promises on timelines. 
 Right now I am prepping the app to support the Bridge. And while doing so I‚Äôll add some device ID‚Äôs and  a few new devices. When this is done I will add support for the more complex devices. 
 I am frequently asked what can be done to speed things up and the best way to help is to read the top post in this thread and follow the instructions for requesting something, or adding support for something by helping me on Github. 
 Donations are also welcome, I use any cash I get to invest in the units I have to buy to be able to test/add support for‚Ä¶ and some beer to enjoy after coding

Hi all. 
Since the introduction of the cloud and bridge there has been quite some fuss about how us community developers should handle the need to be a verified developer to be able to support the cloud/bridge. 
 Athom has finally decided they want developers like me to use a ‚Äúprofile account‚Äù rather than a personal one when releasing an app for the cloud/bridge. Reason is that all apps from a verified developer will have the verified label, even apps that are not approved for the cloud/bridge, and for developers like me who has a number of apps that will only be available on the Pro platform this could be misleading. 
 I understand and accept Athom‚Äôs decision and will at some point soon transfer this app to a new account but it will still be me managing it. Your installations and future upgrades will not be affected by this change. 
 Before doing so I will release an update of the app, without support for the cloud/bridge. It includes more than 50 added device id‚Äôs. 
 I am well aware of the many requests and the interest in more frequent updates and while I share the passion for the app time has been limited. And frankly the issues regarding cloud/bridge support and accounts has been somewhat discouraging, but that‚Äôs sorted now so I‚Äôm all eager to get things going again. 
 Thanks for the great support by everyone!

---
   What‚Äôs new? 
 The tuya-light branch is now officially online! 
It delivers a stable, English‚Äëonly driver pack for Tuya Zigbee SDK3 devices, fully compatible with Homey Pro (early 2023+) and CLI installation. 
Designed with simplicity and reliability in mind ‚Äî no AI, no automation layers ‚Äî just drivers that work. 
 
   What‚Äôs included? 
   Category	  Example Devices / Notes 
   On/Off Switches	TS0001 / TS0011 / TS0002 / TS0003, _TZ3000_xxxxx 
  Dimmers	TS110F / TS1111 / _TZ3000_qzjcsmar, rotary dimmers 
  Plugs (Basic/PM)	TS011F / TS0115 / TS0101, with or without energy meter 
  Curtain / Shutter	TS130F, TZE200 & TZ3000 supported motors 
  Contact Sensors	TS0203, TZ3000 devices, RH3001 
  Motion / Presence	TS0202, TZ3000_mmtwjmaq, RH3040, occupancy sensors 
  Temp/Humidity Sensors	TS0201, TS0601, TZE200_cwbvmsar 
  Scene Switches	TS004F / TS0041 / TZ3000_xxxx, up to 4 buttons 
  Others (PIR, CO, etc.)	Gas/CO, radar, soil, light sensors, presence detection 
  Lights & RGBW	TS0505B, RGB/CCT controllers and LED drivers 
  Thermostats / TRVs	TZE200_c88teujp, TZE200_9mahtqtg etc. 
 
   Device ID Coverage 
 
 Over 300+ unique deviceId / productId values are already included! 
All extracted directly from /drivers/sdk3/ and validated. 
Every driver.compose.json is clearly structured and maintained. 
 
   A few highlights: 
 ‚úì PIR:       _TZ3000_mmtwjmaq, _TZ3000_kmh5qpmb 
‚úì TH Sensor: TS0201, TS0601, _TZE200_cwbvmsar 
‚úì Plugs:     _TZ3000_g5xawfcq, _TZ3000_vzopcetz, TS011F 
‚úì Remotes:   _TZ3000_xxxxxxxx (4-gang switches) 
‚úì RGBW:      TS0505B,  TZE200  LED strip drivers 
‚úì Curtain:   TS130F motors and modules 
‚úì TRV:        TZE200  thermostats for radiator valves 
   Total Device IDs Supported: 300+ (from ~80+ unique drivers) 
 
   Why use TUYA‚ÄëLIGHT? 
   Feature	  Description 
   Clean Architecture	Homey SDK3 native, no legacy logic or redundancy 
  Full English Support	All capabilities, labels, UI and logs are in EN only 
  CLI Ready	Install via homey app install ‚Äì no need for store 
  Device Optimized	Focused per-device logic ‚Äì no generic fallback, no bugs 
  Modular Drivers	Drivers = 1 device type, clean separation of logic 
  No AI / No Overhead	Pure SDK3, no automation, minimal footprint 
 
   What‚Äôs next? The Universal Version   
 The main branch of the project continues evolving into a smarter, AI‚Äëpowered device integration layer. 
   Roadmap includes: 
   AI‚Äëbased device identification & dynamic fallback 
   Automatic capability mapping 
   Context-aware behavior & flow integration 
   GitHub dashboard to track progress 
   Multi‚Äëdriver loader for embedded device libraries 
   Auto‚Äëgenerated multilingual documentation (EN/FR) 
   Stay tuned here: 
  Universal Tuya Zigbee GitHub 
  Community thread
